ICSU http://www.icsu.org These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 7. ICSU President inaugurates 50th Annual Convention of Indian Geophysical Union http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/top-news/icsu-president-inaugurates-50th-annual-convention-of-indian-geophysical-union Professor Yuan Tseh Lee inaugurates the Golden Jubilee celebrations of the Indian Geophysical Union (IGU) The President of ICSU Professor Yuan Tseh Lee, inaugurated the Golden Jubilee Convention of the Indian Geophysical Union at the National Geophysical Research Institute of India in Hyderabad this morning (8 January). The Union was established in 1963 to provide a forum for geophysicists in India and encourage research, publication and exchange in the field.The theme of the celebrations "Sustainability of Earth Systems: Future Challenges" is closely related to the new initiative by ICSU and its partners, Future Earth. A full day of the 4-day Annual Convention will be devoted to presentations and discussions on Future Earth. Professor Lee will deliver a keynote entitled "The Sustainability of Human Society" during the Session on Future Earth. The session during the Convention will serve to raise the awareness of geophysicists and other scientists in India on research for global sustainability and how they can contribute to the initiative.

More information about the Convention may be obtained from the IGU website http://www.igu.in/50annual.pdf

List of papers that will be presented during the Convention

\ufffd\ufffd

All information on the General Assembly can be found at the portal accessible through the link below. There is also a Facebook event you can join.

]]> No publisher Johannes Mengel General Assembly International Scientific Unions Strategic planning Foresight Scientific Associates National Members 2013-09-23T13:45:00Z Event ROAP's close associate appointed Director UNU-IIGH http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/professor-capon-appointed-director-uni-iigh Professor Anthony Capon who was a member of the ICSU ROAP Science Planning Group on Health and Wellbeing in the Changing Urban Environment has been appointed Director, United Nations University, International Institute for Global Health (UNI-IIGH) Professor Anthony G. Capon who was a member of the ICSU Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific (ROAP) Science Planning Group on Health and Wellbeing in the Changing Urban Environment (2010 - 2011), has been appointed Director of the United Nations University International Institute for Global Health (UNU-IIGH), with effect from 1 August 2013.The Institute located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia was established in 2007. It contributes through research and training activities, to the development and strengthening of health services policy frameworks and management actions, particularly in developing countries. It strongly supports preventive approaches to human health.

According to the UNU news statement, Professor Capon is a public health physician and an authority on environmental health and health promotion who has more than two decades of senior leadership and management experience in public health research, education and policy.\ufffd\ufffdPrior to joining UNU, Prof. Capon was a Professor of Public Health and Head, Discipline of Public Health, at the University of Canberra. In 2008, he contributed to the work of the ICSU planning group that developed a global interdisciplinary science programme on health and well-being in the changing urban environment using the systems approach. ICSU ROAP is currently developing a suite of pilot project proposals to explore how the systems approach can be successfully used to enhance urban health planning and management in six cities in Asia.

The UNU announcement of Professor Caapon's appointment may be found at http://unu.edu/news/news/anthony-capon-new-unu-iigh-director.html

Related link: http://www.canberra.edu.au/monitor/2013/aug/2_tony-capon_unu

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Health and wellbeing Capacity building Outreach Scientific Associates Applied science Research and development Regional Offices 2013-08-12T04:10:00Z News Item ICSU participates in 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/icsu-participates-in-12th-pacific-science-inter-congress Announcing ICSU ROAP's contributions to the 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress in Suva, Fiji ICSU will participate in the 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress from 8 to 12 July 2013 in Suva, Fiji. The theme of the inter-congress is Science for Human Security and Sustainability in the Pacific Islands and Rim. Nordin Hasan, Director, ICSU Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific (ROAP) will deliver a keynote address entitled Future Earth:: A new international platform for research on global sustainabillity. The Inter-congress is organized by the Pacific Science Association and the University of the South Pacific where it will be held. A Panel Discussion has been scheduled to discuss the implementation of Future Earth in the Pacific Island countries. Nordin will also be speaking about the ICSU initiative on urban health and wellbeing and presenting a paper written with Katrina Proust of the Australian National University on the development of pilot projects on the systems approach to urban health and wellbeing research in the Asia-Pacific region. For more details of the inter-congress, please visit http://www.psi2013.usp.ac.fj/

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Food security Sustainable development Environment Regional Offices Global sustainability research Hazards and disasters Global environmental change Ecosystems Research and development Biodiversity Health and wellbeing Scientific Associates Applied science Basic science Traditional knowledge Energy Earth system science Climate research Science for Policy Education Social sciences 2013-07-05T07:35:00Z News Item Science Council of Asia endorses Future Earth http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/science-council-of-asia-endorses-future-earth 13th Annual Conference of the Science Council of Asia endorses Future Earth The Science Council of Asia (SCA) endorsed Future Earth as a very important global research framework, at its 13 Annual Conference held in Bangkok, Thailand on 7 - 9 May 2013. Professor Chao Han Liu (Center for Sustainability Science, Academia Sinica), speaking during a panel discussion on Future Earth at the Conference said that many answers are needed from Asia and the Pacific on the question of global sustainability. Alternatives needed to be sought to the currently energy and material intensive approach to development practised by industrialised countries. In addition research are needed on tipping points arising from albedo changes in the Tibetan Plateau, on transformations of the ENSO trigering mechanism, and on transformations occurring with the Indian Monsoon and on the thawing of the Siberian permafrost and release of greenhouse gasses. According to a recent publication permafrost covers 24 percent of the land surface of the Northern Hemisphere and significant thawing could affect vast areas and release billions of tons of carbon. This has huge implications for ecosystems in the region. Other speakers on the panel highlighted the need fo a new form of science that was more transdisciplinary in character. Professor Supakorn Chinvanno of the Southeast Asia Start Regional Center in Bangkok stressed the need for regional scale research that was holistic and a paradigm shift was required to design appropriate research frameworks on these issues. The theme of the SCA's Annual Conference and General Assembly in 2014 will be Future Earth: Research for global sustainability and a holistic understanding of sustainable development in Asia. The Conference will be held in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Global sustainability research Earth system science Science communication Global environmental change Scientific Associates Applied science Science for Policy Regional Offices 2013-05-13T03:55:00Z News Item Scientific Associates http://www.icsu.org/about-icsu/our-members/scientific-associates Scientific Associates support the objectives of ICSU and uphold the principle of the Universality of Science. Scientific Associates must have been in existence for at least six years and do not have voting rights.

They adhere to ICSU in one of two categories:

  • International Scientific Associates - an international non-governmental organization in the natural sciences or an organization in a field related to those of ICSU, such as the humanistic, medical, social and technical sciences, whose association with ICSU is likely to be of mutual benefit or to advance the cause of science, and whose scientific activities do not fall primarily within the scope of a single Scientific Union Member.
  • Regional Scientific Associates - a non-governmental scientific academy, science council, or other scientific institution, to which scientists or scientific bodies from more than one nation adhere, whose association with ICSU is likely to be of mutual benefit and will facilitate the attainment of ICSU's objectives, and whose scientific activities do not fall primarily within the scope of a single Scientific Union Member.
]]> No publisher Tish Bahmani Fard Scientific Associates 2010-11-25T10:45:00Z Page Announcement: The 11 th Pacific Science Inter-Congress in conjunction with 2 nd Symposium on French Research in the Pacific http://www.icsu.org/icsu-asia/news-centre/news/archive-2006-2010/announcement-the-11-th-pacific-science-inter-congress-in-conjunction-with-2-nd-symposium-on-french-research-in-the-pacific France, French Polynesia, and the Pacific Science Association announced the 11th Pacific Science Inter-Congress, which is oriented around the theme of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdPacific countries and their ocean facing local and global changes\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. The meeting will be held in Papeete, French Polynesia from 2 to 6 March 2009.

The inter-congress will be divided into 5 sessions that includes

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Ecosystems, Biodiversity and Sustainable Development;

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Climate Change and Ocean Acidification;

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Health Challenges in the Pacific: Infectious disease, non-communicable disease and health workforce;

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Culture and Politics: The stake of modernity; and

\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Governance and the Economy: Future challenges for the Pacific.

The official language of the Inter-Congress is English. A simultaneous translation French\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEnglish will also be organized. M ore information on the Inter-Congress can be found on the official website http://www.psi2009.pf
